metadata.title: CVE-2024-42156 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:s390/pkey: Wipe copies of clear-key structures on failureWipe all sensitive data from stack for all IOCTLs, which convert aclear-key into a protected- or secure-key.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42156` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-202-generic - 5.4.0-202.222~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-202-lowlatency - 5.4.0-202.222~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1140-gcp - 5.4.0-1140.149~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1083-ibm - 5.4.0-1083.88~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
